title: Ticket #5417: Erratic startup ASSERTs with shared port on Windows
description:
Sometimes on Windows a daemon (master?) will fail to start up. The system is using shared ports.

Failure is probably in DaemonCore::InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself; one of the ASSERT(X.hasAddrs()) is failing. Probably because the shared port daemon wrote a sinful to file that lacks the addrs field.

However, the sinful the shared port daemon writes is itself from DaemonCore::InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself. All exit paths from DC:ICSSM ASSERT(X.hasAddrs) or return NULL. The only path that doesn't is inside of if(shared_port_endpoint), which should never run on the shared port daemon itself.

So, that's fun.

TJ believes that it works if the first call to DC:ICSSM in the master(?) is inside of a timeout firing. Fiddling with the timing causes DC:ICSSM to return NULL, which is probably expected and doesn't cause the problem.

Current list to investigate:

  • SharedPortEndpoint::UseSharedPort /src/condor_io/shared_port_endpoint.cpp :1176 - Hypothesis: this code is erroneously returning true for the shared port daemon itself, which kinda works, but creates a race condition where we can hit the bad code.

Long shot investigations, all in the shared port daemon:

  • SharedPortServer::PublishAddress() /src/condor_io/shared_port_server.cpp :116
  • DaemonCore::InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself /src/condor_daemon_core.V6 :1086
  • SharedPortEndpoint::GetMyRemoteAddress /src/condor_io/shared_port_endpoint.cpp
  • SharedPortEndpoint::GetMyLocalAddress /src/condor_io/shared_port_endpoint.cpp :865
  • DaemonCore::InitSharedPort /src/condor_daemon_core.V6 :3118
